thread.title: At 6.2°c, Ludhiana Records Season’s Coldest Night | Ludhiana News - Times of India
thread.title_full: At 6.2°c, Ludhiana Records Season’s Coldest Night | Ludhiana News - Times of India

author: Shariq Majeed
title: At 6.2°c, Ludhiana Records Season’s Coldest Night | Ludhiana News - Times of India
text: Ludhiana: Ludhiana on Thursday witnessed coldest night of the ongoing December month as the minimum (night) temperature dropped to 6.2°C. Meanwhile, the met department forecasts night temperature to fall further in the next few days. As per the met officials, the minimum (night) temperature in Ludhiana recorded on Thursday was 6.2°C, which is 0.7 degree less than normal and even 1.6 degrees less than a day before.The data of minimum temperature in ongoing December suggests that the minimum temperature had not dropped to this value in the month till now. On December 7 and 8, the minimum temperature was second low in ongoing month and was recorded at 6.4 degrees Celsius.The maximum (day) temperature in city on Thursday was 20.6°C, which is a degree less than normal and 0.9 degree less than the day before.Meanwhile, the met forecasts ‘partly cloudy sky’ on Friday and Sunday whereas for the remaining days till next Wednesday ‘mainly clear sky’ is expected. It also suggests that the day temperature in Ludhiana is expected to rise to 23 degrees till Sunday and fall to 22 degrees by Monday and remain same the next day whereas the night temperature might fall to 4 degrees by Tuesday.We also published the following articles recentlyWinter chill is back; day temperature dips by 4 degrees CelsiusBhopal shivered through its likely coldest day this season, with temperatures dipping to 23.4C, a significant 4.5C below normal. Sunday night saw the mercury plummet to a chilly 9.2C. Experts predict further drops in the coming days, with Bhopal's minimum temperature potentially reaching 8.5C. While Khandwa experienced a high of 30.5C, Shivpuri recorded a low of 6.8C.116149420Kolkata's minimum temperature at 15.7C, season's lowestKolkata experienced its coldest day of the season so far, with the minimum temperature dipping to 15.7C. A western disturbance is expected to bring clouds and slightly raise the temperature to 16C on Monday.116121072Ahmedabad's minimum temperature likely to drop to 11C today, says IMDAhmedabad experienced a chilly Sunday with the minimum temperature dipping to 13.2 degrees Celsius, slightly lower than Saturday and below normal. The maximum temperature also remained cooler than usual at 30.8 degrees.116109858
